InstallEntry Class Reference

Class responsible for managing all data concerning a package which has been at least partially installed. More...

 The slot occupied by the package pertaining to this entry.

 The state of whether this installation was explicitly requested by the user.

 Should this package be allowed to update when not necessary or expilcity stated.
int mBinaryCompatabilityRevision
 Value used to track whether two revisions of a package have binary compatable interfaces.
string mPackageStatus
 The state to which this package has been installed (unpacked, configured, etc).
bool mInstalledInThisSession
 Indicates that this package was just installed, and its files must be recorded.
string mErrorMessage
 The error message(s) generated by the last action performed on the package.
string mInstallListFilename
 The name of the file listing the files installed by this package.
vector< InstalledFile * > mInstalledFiles
 The files installed by this package.
vector< string > mInstalledSymLinks
 The names of the symbolic links installed by this package.
vector< string > mInstalledDirectories
 The names of the directories installed by this package.
InstructionSequence mUninstallInstructions
 The instructions (if any) executed to remove this package from this system.
PackageDependencyVector mDependencies
 The list of dependencies this package has on other packages.
PackageDependencyVector mReverseDependencies
 The list of the packages which depend on this package.
FeatureOptionVector mFeatures
 The list of optional features and their states used by this package.

Detailed Description

Class responsible for managing all data concerning a package which has been at least partially installed.

Member Function Documentation

bool InstallEntry::ActivateFeature ( string  featureName  ) 
Parameters:
featureName - the name of the feature which is possibly used by this package
Returns:
true if the optional feature has been associated

Activates the feature in the list of features. This does not affect the current installation, but whenever this package is upgraded or reinstalled, the feature will be used.

References GetName(), and mFeatures.

void InstallEntry::ClearDependencies ( InstallLog &  installLog  ) 

Empties the list of dependencies associated with this package, and releases all reverse dependencies which point to this package.

References Revision::GetString(), mDependencies, mPackageName, mPackageRevision, and InstallLog::ReleaseReverseDependenciesTo().

Referenced by AppRover::Install().

void InstallEntry::ConsolidateFiles (  ) 

Removes duplicate and missing files from the file list. Any backup files will be compared against the original file, and will be removed if they are the same or if the original file is missing (don't want backups of obsolete files).

References LoadFileList(), and mInstalledFiles.

Referenced by Package::Install().

bool InstallEntry::DeactivateFeature ( string  featureName  ) 
Parameters:
featureName - the name of the feature which is possibly used by this package
Returns:
true if the optional feature has been associated

Deactivates the feature in the list of features. This does not affect the current installation, but whenever this package is upgraded or reinstalled, the feature will no longer be used.

References GetName(), and mFeatures.

bool InstallEntry::LoadFileList (  )  [private]
Returns:
true if the file list was successfully loaded from disk

Loads the contents of the file described by mInstallListFilename into mInstalledFiles, mInstalledChecksums, and mInstalledDirectories.

References InstalledFile::Load(), mInstalledDirectories, mInstalledFiles, mInstalledSymLinks, and mInstallListFilename.

bool InstallEntry::PurgeLegacyFiles (  ) 

Deletes all non-backup inherited files from disk and removes them from the file list.

Returns:
true if all relevant files were successfully removed

References LoadFileList(), and mInstalledFiles.

void InstallEntry::RemoveReverseDependency ( string  packageName,
string  revision,
int  maxEntries = 1 
)
Parameters:
packageName - name of the package which depends on this package
revision - revision of the package with depends on this package
maxEntries- the maximum number of matching reverse dependencies to remove

This remove up to maxEntries number of reverse dependencies matching the specified name and revision. There can be 2 matching reverse dependencies in the case where the revision has been installed and an attempt to reinstall has been at least configured.

References mReverseDependencies.

bool InstallEntry::TransferFilesTo ( InstallEntry *  target  ) 
Parameters:
target - the install entry to accept ownership of the files, directories, and symlinks associated with this entry
Returns:
false if target is NULL

Transfers ownership of all files, directories, and symbolic links associated with this entry to the target entry. Since it is expected that these files are about to be overwritten by a new install, any files which have a different md5sum than when they were installed will be backed up to files named .<original name>.arbak

Todo:
Should probably add inherited flag for symlinks and directories

References AddInstalledDirectory(), AddInstalledSymLink(), Interpreter::Interpret(), LoadFileList(), mInstalledDirectories, mInstalledFiles, mInstalledSymLinks, mInstallListFilename, InstalledFile::SetBackup(), InstalledFile::SetChecksum(), and InstalledFile::SetInherited().

Referenced by AppRover::Install().

Returns:

References mReverseDependencies.

Referenced by AppRover::Install().

string InstallEntry::Uninstall ( bool  backup = true  ) 
Returns:
the error string or "" if successful

Executes the recorded uinstall instructions if they have been specified. Otherwise, removes all files and directories installed by the package. If backup is true (default), any files which have a different md5sum than when they were installed will be backed up to files named .<original name>.arbak

References InstructionSequence::Execute(), Revision::GetString(), Interpreter::Interpret(), InstructionSequence::IsEmpty(), LoadFileList(), mErrorMessage, mInstalledDirectories, mInstalledFiles, mInstalledSymLinks, mInstallListFilename, mPackageName, mPackageRevision, mPackageStatus, mReverseDependencies, and mUninstallInstructions.

Referenced by AppRover::Uninstall().
